trans-unit.source: Identify the input devices connected to a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) device and identify their capabilities and attributes.
trans-unit.target: Identify the input devices connected to a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) device and identify their capabilities and attributes.

trans-unit.target: Important APIs

trans-unit.source: Windows.Devices.Input
trans-unit.target: Windows.Devices.Input

trans-unit.target: Windows.UI.Input

trans-unit.source: Windows.UI.Xaml.Input
trans-unit.target: Windows.UI.Xaml.Input

trans-unit.source: Identify the input devices connected to a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) device and identify their capabilities and attributes.
trans-unit.target: Identify the input devices connected to a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) device and identify their capabilities and attributes.

trans-unit.source: Retrieve mouse properties
trans-unit.target: Retrieve mouse properties

trans-unit.source: The [**Windows.Devices.Input**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225648) namespace contains the [**MouseCapabilities**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225626) class used to retrieve the properties exposed by one or more connected mice.
trans-unit.target: The [**Windows.Devices.Input**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225648) namespace contains the [**MouseCapabilities**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225626) class used to retrieve the properties exposed by one or more connected mice.

trans-unit.source: Just create a new **MouseCapabilities** object and get the properties you're interested in.
trans-unit.target: Just create a new **MouseCapabilities** object and get the properties you're interested in.

trans-unit.source: **Note** The values returned by the properties discussed here are based on all detected mice: Boolean properties return non-zero if at least one mouse supports a specific capability, and numeric properties return the maximum value exposed by any one mouse.
trans-unit.target: **Note** The values returned by the properties discussed here are based on all detected mice: Boolean properties return non-zero if at least one mouse supports a specific capability, and numeric properties return the maximum value exposed by any one mouse.

trans-unit.source: The following code uses a series of [**TextBlock**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209652) elements to display the individual mouse properties and values.
trans-unit.target: The following code uses a series of [**TextBlock**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209652) elements to display the individual mouse properties and values.

trans-unit.source: Retrieve keyboard properties
trans-unit.target: Retrieve keyboard properties

trans-unit.source: The [**Windows.Devices.Input**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225648) namespace contains the [**KeyboardCapabilities**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225623) class used to retrieve whether a keyboard is connected.
trans-unit.target: The [**Windows.Devices.Input**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225648) namespace contains the [**KeyboardCapabilities**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225623) class used to retrieve whether a keyboard is connected.

trans-unit.source: Just create a new **KeyboardCapabilities** object and get the [**KeyboardPresent**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225625) property.
trans-unit.target: Just create a new **KeyboardCapabilities** object and get the [**KeyboardPresent**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225625) property.

trans-unit.source: The following code uses a [**TextBlock**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209652) element to display the keyboard property and value.
trans-unit.target: The following code uses a [**TextBlock**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209652) element to display the keyboard property and value.

trans-unit.source: Retrieve touch properties
trans-unit.target: Retrieve touch properties

trans-unit.source: The [**Windows.Devices.Input**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225648) namespace contains the [**TouchCapabilities**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225644) class used to retrieve whether any touch digitizers are connected.
trans-unit.target: The [**Windows.Devices.Input**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225648) namespace contains the [**TouchCapabilities**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225644) class used to retrieve whether any touch digitizers are connected.

trans-unit.source: Just create a new **TouchCapabilities** object and get the properties you're interested in.
trans-unit.target: Just create a new **TouchCapabilities** object and get the properties you're interested in.

trans-unit.source: **Note** The values returned by the properties discussed here are based on all detected touch digitizers: Boolean properties return non-zero if at least one digitizer supports a specific capability, and numeric properties return the maximum value exposed by any one digitizer.
trans-unit.target: **Note** The values returned by the properties discussed here are based on all detected touch digitizers: Boolean properties return non-zero if at least one digitizer supports a specific capability, and numeric properties return the maximum value exposed by any one digitizer.

trans-unit.source: The following code uses a series of [**TextBlock**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209652) elements to display the touch properties and values.
trans-unit.target: The following code uses a series of [**TextBlock**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209652) elements to display the touch properties and values.

trans-unit.source: Retrieve pointer properties
trans-unit.target: Retrieve pointer properties

trans-unit.source: The [**Windows.Devices.Input**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225648) namespace contains the [**PointerDevice**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225633) class used to retrieve whether any detected devices support pointer input (touch, touchpad, mouse, or pen).
trans-unit.target: The [**Windows.Devices.Input**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225648) namespace contains the [**PointerDevice**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225633) class used to retrieve whether any detected devices support pointer input (touch, touchpad, mouse, or pen).

trans-unit.source: Just create a new **PointerDevice** object and get the properties you're interested in.
trans-unit.target: Just create a new **PointerDevice** object and get the properties you're interested in.

trans-unit.source: **Note** The values returned by the properties discussed here are based on all detected pointer devices: Boolean properties return non-zero if at least one device supports a specific capability, and numeric properties return the maximum value exposed by any one pointer device.
trans-unit.target: **Note** The values returned by the properties discussed here are based on all detected pointer devices: Boolean properties return non-zero if at least one device supports a specific capability, and numeric properties return the maximum value exposed by any one pointer device.

trans-unit.source: The following code uses a table to display the properties and values for each pointer device.
trans-unit.target: The following code uses a table to display the properties and values for each pointer device.
